intro: Hieracium svegense, commonly known as the Swedish hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium svegense is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
